    • unwrapOrElse

      public @NonNull T unwrapOrElse(@NonNull Supplier<@NonNull T> supplier)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Returns the contained value if present, otherwise computes a fallback value.

      Use this when the fallback value is expensive to compute or has side effects. The supplier is only called if this Option is None.

      Specified by:
      unwrapOrElse in interface Option<T>
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplier to call if this is None
      Returns:
      the wrapped value if Some, otherwise the result of calling the supplier

    • map

      public <U> @NonNull Option<U> map(@NonNull Function<T,@NonNull U> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Transforms the contained value by applying a function, if present.

      This is the primary way to transform values inside an Option without unwrapping and re-wrapping. If this is None, the function is not called and None is returned.

      Specified by:
      map in interface Option<T>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the result
      Parameters:
      fn - the function to apply to the value
      Returns:
      Some with the transformed value if this is Some, otherwise None

    • flatMap

      public <U> @NonNull Option<U> flatMap(@NonNull Function<T,@NonNull Option<U>> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Transforms the contained value with a function that returns an Option.

      Use this when the transformation itself might not produce a value. This prevents nested Option<Option<T>> types. Also known as "bind" or "chain" in other languages.

      Specified by:
      flatMap in interface Option<T>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of value in the returned Option
      Parameters:
      fn - the function that returns an Option
      Returns:
      the result of applying the function if this is Some, otherwise None

    • filter

      public @NonNull Option<T> filter(@NonNull Predicate<T> predicate)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Returns this Option if it contains a value that matches the predicate, otherwise returns None.

      Useful for conditional checking without unwrapping.

      Specified by:
      filter in interface Option<T>
      Parameters:
      predicate - the predicate to test the value against
      Returns:
      this Option if Some and the predicate returns true, otherwise None

    • and

      public <U> @NonNull Option<U> and(@NonNull Option<U> other)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Returns the provided Option if this is Some, otherwise returns None.

      Implements logical AND behavior - both Options must have values for the result to have a value. The value from this Option is discarded. 

      
 Option<String> first = Option.some("hello");
 Option<Integer> second = Option.some(42);
 Option<Integer> result = first.and(second); // Some(42)

 Option<String> none = Option.none();
 Option<Integer> result2 = none.and(second); // None

 // Useful for sequencing checks
 return hasPermission()
     .and(hasValidToken())
     .and(loadUserData());
      Specified by:
      and in interface Option<T>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the other Option's value
      Parameters:
      other - the Option to return if this is Some
      Returns:
      other if this is Some, otherwise None
      See Also:
      • for a lazy version

    • andThen

      public <U> @NonNull Option<U> andThen(@NonNull Function<T,@NonNull Option<U>> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Applies a function that returns an Option if this is Some, otherwise returns None.

      This is essentially an alias for Option.flatMap(Function), but emphasizes the sequencing/chaining aspect. The name comes from Rust's Option API. 

      
 Option<User> user = authenticate(credentials)
     .andThen(token -> validateToken(token))
     .andThen(userId -> loadUser(userId));
      Specified by:
      andThen in interface Option<T>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of value in the returned Option
      Parameters:
      fn - the function to apply if this is Some
      Returns:
      the result of applying the function if this is Some, otherwise None

    • or

      public @NonNull Option<T> or(@NonNull Option<T> other)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Returns this Option if it contains a value, otherwise returns the provided alternative.

      Implements logical OR behavior - returns the first Option that has a value. 

      
 // Try cache, fall back to database
 Option<User> user = cache.get(id).or(database.get(id));

 // Multiple fallbacks
 Option<Config> config = loadFromFile("config.json")
     .or(loadFromFile("config.yml"))
     .or(loadDefaults());

 Option<String> some = Option.some("first");
 Option<String> backup = Option.some("second");
 some.or(backup); // Some("first") - backup not used

 Option<String> none = Option.none();
 none.or(backup); // Some("second") - backup used
      Specified by:
      or in interface Option<T>
      Parameters:
      other - the alternative Option to use if this is None
      Returns:
      this Option if Some, otherwise other
      See Also:
      • for a lazy version

    • orElse

      public @NonNull Option<T> orElse(@NonNull Supplier<@NonNull Option<T>> supplier)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Returns this Option if it contains a value, otherwise computes an alternative.

      Lazy version of Option.or(Option). The supplier is only called if this Option is None. Use this when the fallback is expensive to compute or has side effects. 

      
 // Lazy computation - database only queried if cache misses
 Option<User> user = cache.get(id).orElse(() ->
     database.query(id)
 );

 // Chained lazy fallbacks
 Option<Config> config = loadPrimaryConfig()
     .orElse(() -> loadBackupConfig())
     .orElse(() -> generateDefaultConfig());
      Specified by:
      orElse in interface Option<T>
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplier to call if this is None
      Returns:
      this Option if Some, otherwise the result of calling the supplier

    • toNullable

      public T toNullable()
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Converts this Option to a nullable value.

      Use this when interfacing with APIs that expect nullable values. This is the inverse of Option.ofNullable(Object). 

      
 Option<String> some = Option.some("hello");
 String value = some.toNullable(); // "hello"

 Option<String> none = Option.none();
 String nullValue = none.toNullable(); // null

 // Using with legacy API
 map.put("key", option.toNullable());
      Specified by:
      toNullable in interface Option<T>
      Returns:
      the contained value if Some, otherwise null

    • zip

      Description copied from interface: Option
      Combines this Option with another, returning Some only if both are Some. For Some(a) and Some(b): returns Some(Pair(a, b)) For any other combination: returns None
      Specified by:
      zip in interface Option<T>
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Specified by:

    • transpose

      Description copied from interface: Option
      Transposes an Option of a Result into a Result of an Option. For Some(Ok(value)): returns Ok(Some(value)) For Some(Err(error)): returns Err(error) For None: returns Ok(None)

    • xor

      public @NonNull Option<T> xor(@NonNull Option<T> other)
      Description copied from interface: Option
      Returns this Option if it is Some, otherwise returns other if other is Some. Returns None only if both are None. For Some: returns this For None and other is Some: returns other For None and other is None: returns None
      Specified by:
      xor in interface Option<T>
      Parameters:
      other - the alternative Option
      Returns:
      this if Some, other if this is None and other is Some, None if both are None

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
